title: Optometrist - Strathfield Eyecare
description:
## Job Overview

> Part Time - Strathfield, NSW

Join a small, supportive team at Strathfield Eyecare, an independent, full-scope practice serving the community for over 21 years.

Share dispensing duties while focusing on quality patient care in a collaborative environment.

## What We’re Looking For
* Passion for delivering exceptional eye care
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Interest or experience in myopia management & dry eye care
* Korean-speaking skills a bonus, but not essential
* Recent graduates welcome

## What We Offer
* Friendly, professional team of optometrists
* State-of-the-art equipment: Myopia Master, Topographer, OCT, K5M, Envision IPL/RF, DNEye scanner
* Support via the ProVision network
* Generous salary with uncapped revenue-sharing
* Flexible start date

title: Optometrist / Optyk (m/f/d) – Oportunitate de a-ți conduce propriul magazin - Germania
description:
## About Us

> Über Uns

Η SuperVista AG, με το brand brillen.de, προσφέρει μια μοναδική ευκαιρία σε άτομα με επιχειρηματικό πνεύμα, που είναι έτοιμα να ξεκινήσουν τη δραστηριότητά τους στη Γερμανία ως ανεξάρτητοι αδειούχοι – χωρίς απαιτούμενη ίδια κεφαλαιακή επένδυση.

## The unique offer includes
* Δοκιμαστική περίοδος: 6 μήνες για να δοκιμάσετε τη δραστηριότητά σας ως επιχειρηματίας.
* Οικονομική ασφάλεια: Κατά τη διάρκεια της 6μηνης δοκιμαστικής περιόδου θα λαμβάνετε προμήθεια τουλάχιστον 35% από όλα τα έσοδα του καταστήματος. Από αυτήν την προμήθεια θα καλύπτετε τα έξοδα προσωπικού και ενοικίασης. Σας εγγυόμαστε ότι, μετά την αφαίρεση αυτών των εξόδων, θα σας απομένουν τουλάχιστον 3.000 ευρώ.
* Υποστήριξη και εκπαίδευση: Πλήρη εκπαιδευτικά μαθήματα και συνεχής υποστήριξη για την ανάπτυξη των επιχειρηματικών δεξιοτήτων που απαιτούνται για την επιτυχία.
* Υψηλής ποιότητας γυαλιά σχεδιαστών: Αυτόματα θα γίνετε και συνεργάτης των THE GOOD BRAND OPTICIANS, όπου θα πουλάτε γυαλιά σχεδιαστών υψηλής ποιότητας, στην μεσαία προς υψηλή κατηγορία τιμών, με προμήθεια 50%, χωρίς δικά σας έξοδα μάρκετινγκ ή αποθεμάτων. Μοναδικό concept στη Γερμανία.
* Υποστήριξη για την απόκτηση άδειας εργασίας: Αν είναι απαραίτητο, θα λάβετε πλήρη υποστήριξη για την έκδοση βίζας ή άδειας εργασίας.

## After the trial period
* Μόνιμη ανάληψη: Σε περίπτωση αμοιβαίου ενδιαφέροντος και ικανοποίησης των προσδοκιών μας, μπορείτε να αναλάβετε το υποκατάστημα μόνιμα.
* Ευνοϊκοί όροι: Μηνιαίο τέλος ανάληψης μόλις 600 ευρώ.

## Your Advantages
* Επιχειρηματική ελευθερία: Σχηματίστε το δικό σας μέλλον και αναλάβετε τον έλεγχο της δραστηριότητας του καταστήματος σας.
* Υψηλότερα έσοδα: Επωφεληθείτε άμεσα από την επιτυχία σας μέσω ενός μοντέλου αμοιβής βασισμένου στην απόδοση.
* Υποστήριξη για άδεια εργασίας: Προσφέρουμε βοήθεια σε καταρτισμένους υποψηφίους από το εξωτερικό για την απόκτηση της απαραίτητης άδειας εργασίας.

## Your Opportunity
* Υφιστάμενες επιχειρήσεις: Αναλάβετε άμεσα υφιστάμενες επιχειρήσεις με μεγάλη βάση πελατών.
* Επαφή με πελάτες: Καθημερινά ραντεβού με πελάτες που ενδιαφέρονται να αγοράσουν τα γυαλιά μας.
* Επιτυχία χωρίς κεφάλαιο: Απολαύστε πολύ καλά έσοδα χωρίς να χρησιμοποιήσετε δικό σας κεφάλαιο. Αυτό που απαιτούμε είναι η πλήρης δέσμευσή σας και η μέγιστη επιθυμία πώλησης.

title: Optometrist | Toorak
description:
## Job Overview

> Casual Optometrist | Toorak

Do you want to take more time, more care, and get to know your patients better? Our team in Toorak are looking for a Casual Optometrist to embed themselves in the local community and continue their tradition of providing exceptional eyecare. Working alongside Ophthalmologist Dr Harry Unger and a highly regarded team, this role offers the chance to shape the patient experience at one of Melbourne’s most prestigious addresses.

## Skills And Experience
If you are someone who loves to provide an amazing patient experience to achieve goals, leading your team to greatness, then this role may be for you. We are searching for someone with the following skills:
* Optometrist qualification with +2 years practical experience
* Be able to use your optical knowledge and experience to communicate clearly with patients in a bright and friendly manner
* Have a passion about putting the customer’s eye health first
* A passion for optical style and fashion
* Willing to keep up-to-date with industry developments

## Benefits And Perks
At G&M Eyecare we are determined to hire the best people and give them the freedom and flexibility to look after patients at the local level with the support of a proudly Australian organisation. We offer a down-to-earth and friendly working environment with mentoring and support. Also, on offer is:
* A competitive annual salary package + super + OA + AHPRA + CPD Allowance
* Earn extra cash every two weeks with a fortnightly bonus structure!
* Continuing education and ongoing training and development
* Free eye examinations, annual product allowance and family and friends’ discounts and benefits – because we care about the people you care about
* Career progression and development with support from our Professional Services team
* The chance to feel truly independent while having the additional support of our office functions

## About The Business
Our practice has a focus on comprehensive eye examinations, prescription sunglasses, spectacle frames, contact lenses, and eye health care for the whole family. At G&M Eyecare we believe that no two pairs of eyes are the same. Every individual has something unique to bring to their role, that’s why we encourage and support diversity in all its forms. At G&M Eyecare we are committed to making the environment you work in inclusive and enabling.

title: Orthoptic Casual
description:
## Job Overview

> Employment Type: Casual
> Position Classification: Orthoptist Level 1/2
> Remuneration: $37.03 - $52.83 per hour plus superannuation
> Hours Per Week: Up to 38

## The Role
This opportunity is to join our Prince of Wales Orthoptic casual pool. Orthoptists in our casual pool, pending their availability may be called upon at short notice or may be rostered in advance to cover shift vacancies. Orthoptists work part of a multidisciplinary team in the Eye Clinic at Prince of Wales Hospital to provide orthoptic and ophthalmic care to outpatients and inpatients.

## What We Offer
* Up to 12 allocated days off each year (for full-time employees) in addition to annual leave.
* Salary packaging options that reduce your taxable income and increase your take-home pay! Up to $9K for living expenses and $2.6K meal & entertainment & Novated Leasing.
* Discounted gym memberships with a Fitness Passport
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for employees and family members.
* Discounted Private Health Insurance.
* Inner city location with direct access to eastern suburbs beaches, restaurants and transport links that are right at the front door

## Selection Criteria
To be considered for this position, please ensure you address the below questions as thoroughly as possible.
* Must hold a Diploma or bachelor of Applied Science (Orthoptics), Masters in Orthoptics or equivalent with eligibility for registration with the Orthoptic Board of Australia.
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the investigation and managment of adult and paediatric patients with strabismus and ocular motility disorders within commensurate years of experience.
* Demonstrated knowledge and ability in ophthalmic assisting including perimetry, OCT, Pentacam, refraction, ocular Biometry
* Demonstrated high level written and verbal communication, and interpersonal skills
* Demonstrated commitment to quality improvement and ability to translate evidence into practice.
* Ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and to exercise independent professional judgement on routine matters, commensurate with years of experience.

title: Casual Optical Dispenser - Charlestown Eyecare
description:
## Job Overview

National Optical Care, are a community of optometry practices that are passionate about empowering eye care excellence. We recently merged with George and Matilda, leveraging the combined expertise of our practice community with strong supplier relationships to deliver the very best in patient care, creating opportunities for career development.

We are searching for a Casual Dispenser to grow our team.

## About The Role
* Provide friendly and efficient reception service
* Assist patients in the selection of optical frames taking into account lifestyle and physical needs
* Recommend use of ancillary products (e.g. contact lens care products).
* Support other team members in the achievement of practice goals and objectives including (but not limited to) processing Medicare, health fund payments, credits / warranties, entering stock, jobs due report, debtor’s management and stock takes
* Maintain a high level of housekeeping in the practice including overall presentation and cleanliness

## Our Benefits
* Learning and development opportunities tailored to your goals
* Great discounts across frames and lenses including family and friends
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Perks and bonus Programs
* Work with a great team who are truly invested in their patients

## About You
* Effective communication and customer service skills both in person and over the phone
* Team focused alongside independent work
* Strong organizational skills and ability to problem solve
* Positive and energetic attitude
* Experience in the optical industry is preferred, however for those eager to take on a new career we are willing to develop
* With no weekend work or late nights

title: Optician
description:
## Job Overview

> Optical Dispenser/Assistant
> Location: Bargara, QLD
> Work type: Full-time (part-time considered for the right person)

## About Us
Clear Optometry is a friendly, independent optometry practice in beautiful beachside Bargara, QLD. We pride ourselves on integrity, attention to detail, and genuine patient care. Our small, supportive team works together to provide outstanding service in a relaxed, coastal setting.

## About the Role
We're looking for an Optical Dispenser/Assistant to join our team. You'll play a key role in making every patient feel welcome and cared for — from helping with frame selection to supporting the optometrist in daily tasks.

Optical experience is highly desirable but not essential for the right person — we're happy to provide training if you bring the right attitude.

## You'll Be
* Friendly, professional, and a real team player
* Detail-focused and organised
* Comfortable using computers and learning new systems
* Flexible to help cover staff absences when needed
* Interested in a long-term role, not just a short-term job

## Why You'll Love It
* Supportive, community-minded workplace
* No evenings or weekends
* Varied, rewarding role in a beautiful coastal town
* Opportunity to grow your skills in a respected local practice

title: Optical Dispenser - Holdfast Bay Optometry
description:
## Job Overview

> Part Time - Glenelg, SA

This is an exciting opportunity to join Holdfast Bay Optometry, an independent practice that prides itself on providing quality eyecare and eyewear solutions to the Glenelg community and beyond.

## About You
You’re someone who thrives on creating great customer experiences and enjoys being part of a small, connected team. You bring:
* Previous experience in an optical or retail setting
* Excellent communication and computer skills
* A genuine interest in style and helping patients choose the perfect frame
* Confidence to assist with social media posts and patient engagement
* Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to learning

## The Role
You’ll be part of the full patient journey - from greeting clients and assisting with eyewear selection to supporting our optometrists and managing admin tasks.

> Hours - Rotating Roster (23–26 hrs/week):
> * Week 1 & 3: Monday 9-2 | Wednesday 9-5:30 | Friday 9-2 | Saturday 9-2
> * Week 2: Monday-Friday 9-5:30 | Saturday 9-2

## Why You’ll Love It Here
* Independent and proudly local - you’re not just a number
* Preventative eyecare focus - “we can see what you can’t!”
* A loyal patient base who value quality and trust
* Bespoke eyewear and premium lens solutions
* Supportive, friendly team that genuinely listens

title: Optical Assistant/Dispenser - iVision Optometrists
description:
## Job Overview

> Full and Part Time available - Leeming, WA

Are you looking for a role that blends purpose, people, and genuine work-life balance? I-Vision Optometrists is seeking an experienced, people-focused Optical Assistant / Dispenser to join our friendly, independent team in Leeming. We currently have both full-time and part-time opportunities available, offering flexibility for the right candidates.

## Why You’ll Love Working with Us
* No late nights. No Sundays.
* A team that values connection.
* Learn, grow, and be supported.
* Real autonomy, real trust.
* A supportive environment.
* Optional creative outlet.

## What You’ll Be Doing
* Helping patients choose frames and lenses that make them see and feel great
* Managing orders, reception, and administrative tasks
* Taking initiative and working independently when required

## About You
* You have optical dispensing or optical retail experience and are ready to take the next step
* You’re motivated, reliable and thrive in a close-knit, positive team
* You’re confident working independently and take pride in delivering great service
* You’re available to start soon (flexible start dates available for the right candidates)

## About I-Vision Optometrists
For over 15 years, we’ve proudly served the Leeming community with personalised, professional eyecare. We’re known for our warm, supportive culture where teamwork, trust and laughter are part of the daily routine.

title: Optical Assistant/Dispenser - Pezzimenti Nixon Optometrists
description:
## Job Overview

> Flexible Hours - Hawthorn, VIC

Join a fun, friendly, and family oriented independent practice where everyone pitches in and supports each other. Pezzimenti Nixon Optometry provides exceptional eye care for the whole family, and we’re looking for a caring and motivated Optical Assistant or Dispenser to join our team.

## What you’ll be doing
* Providing outstanding customer service and helping patients feel at ease
* Assisting across all areas of the practice – from reception to frame styling and lens advice
* Supporting the team during annual or sick leave when possible
* Keeping up to date with the latest eyewear trends and products

## What we’re looking for
* A warm communicator with a passion for helping people
* Experience in retail, customer service, or medical reception (optical experience highly valued but not essential)
* A collaborative team player who’s eager to learn and grow

## What’s on offer
* Part-time or casual role - flexible days and hours
* Training and mentorship to build your optical skills
* A supportive environment where you’ll be encouraged to reach your potential
* Start as soon as you’re ready

title: Optometrist - OPSM Jesmond 1
description:
## About Us

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. At OPSM, we are a leading eyecare and eyewear retailer in Australia and New Zealand with more than 80 years of history. Our aim is to raise the standard of eye health and eyecare, using our world-class technology.

## Your Opportunity
As an Optometrist in our stores you will get to work with world class technology including Retinal Camera, Visual Field Analyser, Non-contact tonometer, Corneal Topographer, Optos UWDRS and OCT. You will also understand the lives behind the eyes and identify how OPSM can help maximise a customer’s lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyecare, while providing the highest level of tailored customer service.

## Your Responsibilities
* Perform eye examinations for a broad range and scope of customers by taking on different types of appointments e.g. kids, contact lenses, therapeutics etc.
* Confidently recommend lens solutions based on customer lifestyles
* Clearly explain lens technology, communicating the features and benefits of lens products to customers including coatings and extras
* Coach and mentor Graduate Optometrists in the usage and recommendation of technology to customers
* Work with the Store Manager and Managing Optometrists to maximise Eyecare revenue, including but not limited to technology, Optometry labour efficiencies and appropriate Medicare billing

## Culture & Benefits
We are the leader in eyewear and eyecare around the world and are proud of our iconic brands, premium products and services. By Joining Us, You Will Enjoy The Following Benefits:
* Diverse career progression opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in areas of interest
* Access to Luxottica's Institute of Professional Development including fellowship programs and post-graduate scholarships
* An in-depth graduate pathway program supported by a local mentor and team
* Local and global volunteering opportunities through our charity partner, OneSight
* A yearly product allowance and product discounts to treat yourself, family and friends

title: Graduate Optometry Development Manager
description:
## What we can do for you

At Specsavers, we know that to reach your full potential you need to work somewhere that will bring out your best. We pride ourselves on offering a workplace with a supportive, driven, flexible and inclusive culture. Here’s a taste of just some of our perks:
* Quarterly bonus scheme
* Two free pairs of glasses each year
* On-site free parking
* Birthday, Volunteer, Professional Development and Paid Parental Leave
* Health & Wellbeing programs
* Fully funded social club – provides a wide range of activities throughout the year

## The Role & Team
We have a unique opportunity for an Optometrist to join our Graduate Optometry Team on a 12 month fixed term contract. Reporting into the Head of Graduate Development for ANZ, you will work in partnership with the three other Graduate Optometry Development Managers to help lead the delivery of the industry leading Specsavers Graduate Program. Your day-to-day will involve working with graduates and store partners to support the clinical and professional development of early-career optometrists. This is the perfect opportunity for you to shift your Optometry career in a new and unique direction!

## The skills we are looking for
* Significant professional experience as an Optometrist
* Essential to this role is the completion of the two-year Specsavers Graduate Program
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to deliver Graduate Program Workshops to small and large audiences
* Ability to build rapport with professionals at all levels and work collaboratively within a fast-paced environment
* Highly organised and strong attention to detail

## About Us
Specsavers are rated the market leader for eye tests, the retailer of choice for contact lenses and one of the fastest growing hearing providers in Australia and New Zealand. We are on a continual mission to transform eye and hearing health by eliminating preventable vision loss and blindness, including Glaucoma and Diabetes, through improved prevention and early detection, as well as providing accessible and affordable hearing care.

title: Experienced Optometrist - Berowra Eye Studio
location: Berowra Waters, New South Wales, Australia
description:
## Job Overview

> Part Time (1-2 days a week)

Berowra Eye Studio is seeking an experienced and caring Optometrist to join our friendly and community-focused practice. This is a great opportunity to be part of a growing independent team that values patient care, professionalism, and genuine connection.

## Why Join Us?
* Supportive, close-knit practice team with a strong community reputation
* Flexible part-time role, 1–2 days per week (days negotiable)
* Work in a welcoming, modern environment with excellent patient continuity
* Enjoy autonomy in your clinical decision-making and patient management

## About The Role
You’ll provide comprehensive eye examinations, manage a variety of cases, and deliver personalised care tailored to each patient. Working alongside our practice owner and experienced support team, you’ll have the time and space to focus on quality optometry - not sales targets.

## About You
* Qualified and experienced Optometrist, registered with AHPRA
* Confident, professional, and patient-centred in your approach
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Enjoy collaborating within a small, supportive team environment

## What We Offer
* Flexible hours and a positive work-life balance
* Supportive team that values your experience and input
* Opportunity to contribute to a practice that prioritises genuine care and community

title: Locum Optometrist
description:
## Job Overview

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry retailer and healthcare provider with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, currently employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all.

We're looking for locum Optometrists capable of delivering a leading practice testing experience, effective eye care and recommendations to patients of diverse demographics.

We currently have opportunities in a range of locations and will support travelling professionals with accommodation, transportation and meal expenses in addition to the agreed fees.

You will experience full professional discretion and clinical autonomy in our modern facilities using leading practice equipment.

By joining our Talent Community you will be kept informed of all our opportunities as they open.

title: Low Vision Consultant
description:
## Job Overview

> Permanent Full Time - Low Vision Consultant
> Spring Hill, QLD Location with Work from Home Flexibility
> Base Salary = $102,132 + Superannuation with Salary Packaging up to $15.9k

## About Us
Quantum, a wholly owned subsidiary of Vision Australia, is proud to provide products and services to people with a print disability (low vision, blindness or a learning difficulty). Our specialist products and services focus on wellness and reablement and meet the diverse needs of people who are blind or have low vision so they can remain an independent and integral part of the community.

## About The Opportunity
As our Low Vision Consultant, you will be responsible for increasing revenue and grow market share through the sales and support of Assistive Technology and living aids to Low Vision and general Disability client. In this role you will also:
* Develop customer/client procurement strategies with the aim of increasing sales of Quantum Low Vision products.
* Represent Quantum at approved regional and metropolitan exhibitions and conferences that are aligned to the Retail strategy and target market segmentation.
* Represent Quantum at metropolitan and regional information days organised by Quantum, Vision Australia and other agencies.
* Build product awareness by offering professional development services to referring Professionals and Vision Australia staff.

## About You
* Evidence of up-to-date comprehensive product knowledge resulting in successful sales to meet customer needs
* A proven track record of meeting sales goals demonstrating a highly ethical and consultative approach to selling
* Formal qualification or Experience such as: Optical Dispensing Diploma, Orthoptist, Optometry, Aged Care or Occupational Therapy desirable
* Recent Experience from a variety of backgrounds considered, either from Optical, Aged Care, or a related Allied Health Care role

## Benefits Of Working At Vision Australia
* Additional leave is available via our purchase leave and accrued day off schemes
* Annual salary review to ensure your pay is in-line with the market rates
* Easy-to-access location
* Professional development opportunities and micro-learning sessions available for all staff

title: Optometrist/Graduate - Gulf & Ranges Optometrists
description:
## Job Overview

> Full or Part Time - Port Augusta, SA

Gulf & Ranges Optometrists have a unique role available for an Optometrist - whether you’re experienced, recently graduated, or anywhere in between. Join our large and supportive team in Port Augusta and experience full-scope optometry in a dynamic regional setting.

## What makes us unique
* Work alongside visiting Ophthalmologists at Port Augusta Hospital each month
* Join a diverse optometry team: 2 senior optometrists, 2 early career optometrists and a graduate - offering daily support and mentoring
* Access structured fortnightly multi-practice CPD, plus external courses for continual growth
* No weekends, and our practice closes between Christmas and New Year
* If you prefer part-time, enjoy a consistent fortnightly roster (4 consecutive days one week, 4-5 the next, depending on FTE preference)

## What we’re looking for
* Passion for full-scope optometry, with an interest in eye health management, therapeutics, and co-management with specialists
* Strong commitment to professional development and patient care
* A team player who thrives in a collaborative, supportive environment
* Dispensing skills a bonus but not essential

## Why you’ll love it here
* A collaborative, values-driven culture (Fun, Attention to detail, Continuous improvement, Trust, Teamwork)
* Opportunity to develop advanced clinical skills with direct support and mentoring
* The unique lifestyle of Port Augusta - the gateway to the Flinders Ranges and Eyre Peninsula, offering bushwalking, camping, swimming with cuttlefish, and easy weekend adventures

title: Optometrist Innisfail OPSM
description:
## Job Overview

Take the next step in your optometry career with OPSM Innisfail, where clinical excellence and lifestyle come together. As an optometrist, you’ll value the variety and challenge of regional practice, working with a diverse patient base and managing a broad scope of clinical cases that keep your skills sharp and rewarding.

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. description:
## About Us

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. At OPSM, we are a leading eyecare and eyewear retailer in Australia and New Zealand with more than 80 years of history. Our aim is to raise the standard of eye health and eyecare, using our world-class technology.

## Your Opportunity
As an Optometrist in our Belconnen store you will get to work with world class technology including Retinal Camera, Visual Field Analyser, Non-contact tonometer, Corneal Topographer, Optos UWDRS and OCT. You will also understand the lives behind the eyes and identify how OPSM can help maximise a customer’s lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyecare, while providing the highest level of tailored customer service.

## Your Responsibilities
* Perform eye examinations for a broad range and scope of customers by taking on different types of appointments e.g. kids, contact lenses, therapeutics etc.
* Confidently recommend lens solutions based on customer lifestyles
* Clearly explain lens technology, communicating the features and benefits of lens products to customers including coatings and extras
* Coach and mentor Graduate Optometrists in the usage and recommendation of technology to customers
* Work with the Store Manager and Managing Optometrists to maximise Eyecare revenue, including but not limited to technology, Optometry labour efficiencies and appropriate Medicare billing

## Culture & Benefits
We are the leader in eyewear and eyecare around the world and are proud of our iconic brands, premium products and services. By Joining Us, You Will Enjoy The Following Benefits:
* Diverse career progression opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in areas of interest
* Access to Luxottica's Institute of Professional Development including fellowship programs and post-graduate scholarships
* An in-depth graduate pathway program supported by a local mentor and team
* Local and global volunteering opportunities through our charity partner, OneSight
* A yearly product allowance and product discounts to treat yourself, family and friends

description:
## Job Overview

Stretching from Caloundra to Noosa, the Sunshine Coast in Queensland offers more than just relaxation – it provides an active lifestyle. This unique mix of coastal and hinterland beauty ensures that every weekend feels like a getaway.

We currently have an amazing opportunity for an experienced optometrist to join our Maroochydore OPSM team. This store is equipped with our latest CLARIFYE technology with Optos NG, OCT, retinal camera, Topography, Auto refractor/K, pachymetry, Biometry, Cataract Retro-Illumination, I-Care, NCT and VF.

At OPSM we are about innovation. We use the most cutting-edge products and technologies and collaborate with an amazing collective of knowledgeable and experienced optical professionals. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 95 years.

We can offer you access to great clinical and business ideals, the opportunity to work alongside other experienced optometrists and you will also get to play a pivotal role in building loyal and trusting relationships with the community to grow the practice. An attractive salary is available for the right candidate as well as a generous product allowance for you to enjoy wearing our premium brands and other benefits too.

title: Casual Optical Dispenser - Charlestown Eyecare
location: Bar Beach, New South Wales, Australia
description:

We recently merged with George and Matilda, leveraging the combined expertise of our practice community with strong supplier relationships to deliver the very best in patient care. Charlestown Eyecare has been offering comprehensive optical care to locals and residents for more than 30 years. We are searching for a Casual Dispenser to grow our team.

* Provide friendly and efficient reception service

* Positive and energetic attitude

title: Optometrist Casual Brisbane North
description:
## Job Overview

At OPSM we are obsessed with eye care and offering our patients the confidence in how they see their world. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 93 years. We are not your typical retail business.

We use the most cutting-edge products and technologies, and collaborate with an amazing collective of knowledgeable and experienced Optical professionals. As an Optometrist with us, you will get to work with world class technology including CLARIFYE, WAM800, OCT (with Biometry), IPL, the Optos Next Generation.

Currently, we have a position available on our Casual Brisbane Optometry Relief Team for a recent graduate or experienced optometrist to join our team. This position would suit an optometrist that likes variety and enjoys working in well equipped practices alongside experienced and supportive optometrists and dispensing teams.

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. You will be able to access many opportunities for continuing professional development through financially supported industry training, peer learning communities and product training. We offer competitive salaries and incentives, a generous product allowance, and lots of other great benefits too.

description:

> Full Time - Mount Gambier, SA

You’ll be immersed in full-scope optometry with strong mentoring, structured training, and the chance to work closely with ophthalmologists and a diverse patient base.

* Grow your clinical confidence through measured skill development and personalised learning pathways

## Why Join Fire Station Optometrists?
* Work in a respected regional practice with deep community ties
* Collaborate with a team across three locations with regular peer connection and CPD
* Enjoy a relaxed, regional lifestyle with easy access to the Limestone Coast, the Grampians, and the Great Ocean Road

Seeking a qualified and AHPRA registered Optometrist to join our globally growing network of optometry services. Joint venture partnership opportunities and relocation support available. Full time, Tuesday to Saturday availability preferred.

We also offer Joint Venture Partnership opportunities and relocations to achieve your personal and financial goals.

title: Optical Assistant/Dispenser - Lakeview Eyecare
description:
## Job Overview

> Part Time - Patterson Lakes

Lakeview Eyecare is a proudly independent, locally owned practice that’s been caring for our community’s eyes for over 30 years. We’re now looking for someone to join our small, friendly team to help us continue delivering the personalised eyecare our patients know and trust.

## About You
You’re someone who enjoys connecting with people and providing great service. You bring strong retail experience, love learning new things, and work well in a team environment. If you have marketing knowledge or experience - fantastic! Optical dispensing experience is also welcome, but not essential - we’re happy to support the right person to grow in the role.

## When We Need You
* Monday: full day
* Thursday: hours to be discussed
* Saturday: 9am–1pm You’ll also have the flexibility to cover annual or sick leave when needed.

## Why You’ll Love Working Here
* Diverse and loyal patient base
* Genuine learning and development opportunities
* A well-run, cohesive team of four
* Convenient location in a small local shopping centre

## Our Culture
At Lakeview Eyecare, we love working in the community, for the community. Our optometrists are passionate about eyecare, continuous learning, and staying at the forefront of new research and technology. We take pride in offering thoughtful, tailored solutions - and in creating an environment where both patients and team members feel genuinely cared for.

title: OPSM Optometrist - Merimbula
description:
## About Us

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. At OPSM, we are a leading eyecare and eyewear retailer in Australia and New Zealand with more than 80 years of history. Our aim is to raise the standard of eye health and eyecare, using our world-class technology.

## Your Opportunity
As an Optometrist in our Merimbula store you will get to work with world class technology including Visual Field Analyser, Non-contact tonometer, Optos UWDRS and OCT. You will also understand the lives behind the eyes and identify how OPSM can help maximise a customer’s lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyecare, while providing the highest level of tailored customer service.

## Your Responsibilities
* Perform eye examinations for a broad range and scope of customers by taking on different types of appointments e.g. kids, contact lenses, therapeutics etc.
* Confidently recommend lens solutions based on customer lifestyles
* Clearly explain lens technology, communicating the features and benefits of lens products to customers including coatings and extras
* Coach and mentor Graduate Optometrists in the usage and recommendation of technology to customers
* Work with the Store Manager and Managing Optometrists to maximise Eyecare revenue, including but not limited to technology, Optometry labour efficiencies and appropriate Medicare billing

## Culture & Benefits
We are the leader in eyewear and eyecare around the world and are proud of our iconic brands, premium products and services. By Joining Us, You Will Enjoy The Following Benefits:
* Diverse career progression opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in areas of interest
* Access to Luxottica's Institute of Professional Development including fellowship programs and post-graduate scholarships
* An in-depth graduate pathway program supported by a local mentor and team
* Local and global volunteering opportunities through our charity partner, OneSight
* A yearly product allowance and product discounts to treat yourself, family and friends

title: Optical Assistant/Dispenser - Eyecentric
description:
## Job Overview

> Part Time - Manuka, ACT

Are you detail-oriented, customer-focused, and passionate about fashion-forward eyewear? Eyecentric in Manuka, Canberra, is seeking a dedicated Optical Assistant/Dispenser to join our boutique practice.

## About the Role
This role offers a unique opportunity to work closely with our optometrists, providing high-quality optical dispensing services while assisting with administrative and clinical support. You’ll enjoy variety in your day - from dispensing and frame styling, to pre-testing, contact lens teaching, and supporting dry eye treatments (full training provided).

## Key Responsibilities
* Provide expert advice on lens and frame selection to suit patients’ needs
* Perform dispensing, adjustments, and frame repairs
* Support optometrists with pre-testing and patient care
* Assist with contact lens teaching and dry eye treatments
* Maintain accurate patient records
* Contribute to merchandising and visual presentation of frames
* Opportunity to assist with practice social media content

## Who You Are
* Experienced in optical dispensing or keen to develop your dispensing skills
* Organised, detail-focused, and reliable
* Excellent communicator with a warm, patient-first approach
* Customer service-oriented and professionally presented
* Team player with a flair for fashion and eyewear styling

## Who We Are
Eyecentric is a family-run, boutique optometry practice in the heart of vibrant Manuka. With a reputation for exceptional patient care and carefully curated eyewear, we offer a supportive, fun workplace that encourages continuous learning, professional growth, and involvement in all aspects of the practice.

title: Optical Dispenser
description:
## Who We Are

At onepointsevenfour, we curate the world’s most coveted eyewear – a carefully considered edit of luxury frames that celebrate individuality, style, and craftsmanship. Think of us as your eyewear couturier. Our boutique in Paddington Sydney is nestled in the fashion-forward precinct, home to international brands like Thom Browne, Victoria Beckham, Dior, and Jacques Marie Mage.

## Who You Are
You’re passionate about frames, fashion and love styling patients. Whether you’re an experienced optical dispenser or a fashion retail professional looking to enter the world of premium eyewear, we’d love to meet you. You are:
* Impeccably presented, with a flair for fashion and customer service
* Reliable, self-motivated, and customer-obsessed
* Experienced (2+ years) in either retail, fashion, or optics
* Able to communicate clearly and tailor recommendations to individual needs
* Excited to learn more about eyewear, eye care, and luxury brands

## What You’ll Do
* Deliver exceptional, one-on-one service to our discerning clientele
* Guide customers in selecting sunglasses, optical frames, lenses, and accessories
* Understand lifestyle needs and help clients find eyewear that enhances how they live, work, and feel
* Represent some of the most prestigious eyewear brands globally
* Work collaboratively as part of a passionate, experienced team
* Contribute to the store’s success through product knowledge, service, and sales

## Why Join Us?
This is your chance to work in a beautiful, high-end environment surrounded by artful design and fashion. We offer a generous package plus bonus opportunity. We are currently interviewing for this role – full-time or part-time permanent opportunities available.

title: Optometrist | Mudgee
description:
## Job Overview

> Make Mudgee Yours

This is regional optometry at its best – a high standard of care in a beautiful setting. Mudgee is a nationally recognised tourism town with a strong community spirit, award-winning wineries, and stunning scenery. You will be practicing in a spacious, light-filled, and purpose-fitted terrace home in the heart of town.

## About The Role
This is a wonderful opportunity for an optometrist to join an established practice and continue our legacy of delivering uncompromising local eyecare. You’ll be managing end-to-end eyecare across a wide patient base, in a practice known for its clinical independence, longstanding community trust, and close ties with local GPs and ophthalmologists.

## About The Practice
* Centrally located in the heart of Mudgee’s shopping precinct
* Equipped with advanced diagnostic technology including OCT, Optos widefield imaging, visual fields, and corneal topography
* 30-minute appointments as standard
* A friendly and supportive dispensing team who understands your clinical flow
* Genuine autonomy backed by a national network
* A multigenerational patient base who value continuity and care

title: OPSM Optometrist - Belconnen
description:
## About Us

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. At OPSM, we are a leading eyecare and eyewear retailer in Australia and New Zealand with more than 80 years of history. Our aim is to raise the standard of eye health and eyecare, using our world-class technology.

## Your Opportunity
As an Optometrist in our Belconnen store you will get to work with world class technology including Retinal Camera, Visual Field Analyser, Non-contact tonometer, Corneal Topographer, Optos UWDRS and OCT. You will also understand the lives behind the eyes and identify how OPSM can help maximise a customer’s lifestyle enjoyment factor with appropriate eyecare, while providing the highest level of tailored customer service.

## Your Responsibilities
* Perform eye examinations for a broad range and scope of customers by taking on different types of appointments e.g. kids, contact lenses, therapeutics etc.
* Confidently recommend lens solutions based on customer lifestyles
* Clearly explain lens technology, communicating the features and benefits of lens products to customers including coatings and extras
* Coach and mentor Graduate Optometrists in the usage and recommendation of technology to customers
* Work with the Store Manager and Managing Optometrists to maximise Eyecare revenue, including but not limited to technology, Optometry labour efficiencies and appropriate Medicare billing

## Culture & Benefits
We are the leader in eyewear and eyecare around the world and are proud of our iconic brands, premium products and services. By Joining Us, You Will Enjoy The Following Benefits:
* Diverse career progression opportunities to grow, develop and specialise in areas of interest
* Access to Luxottica's Institute of Professional Development including fellowship programs and post-graduate scholarships
* An in-depth graduate pathway program supported by a local mentor and team
* Local and global volunteering opportunities through our charity partner, OneSight
* A yearly product allowance and product discounts to treat yourself, family and friends

title: Optometrist Casual Gold Coast 1
description:
## Job Overview

At OPSM we are obsessed with eye care and offering our patients the confidence in how they see their world. As a leading eye care and eyewear retailer, we have been looking after the eyes of Australians and New Zealanders for over 93 years. We are not your typical retail business.

We use the most cutting-edge products and technologies, and collaborate with an amazing collective of knowledgeable and experienced Optical professionals. As an Optometrist with us, you will get to work with world class technology including CLARIFYE, WAM800, OCT (with Biometry), IPL, the Optos Next Generation.

Currently, we have a position available on our Casual Gold Coast Optometry Relief Team for a recent graduate or experienced optometrist to join our team. This position would suit an optometrist that likes variety and enjoys working in well equipped practices alongside experienced and supportive optometrists and dispensing teams.

At OPSM we can offer you an opportunity to make a real difference in the way people see the world. You will be able to access many opportunities for continuing professional development through financially supported industry training, peer learning communities and product training. We offer competitive salaries and incentives, a generous product allowance, and lots of other great benefits too.
